intro: Cinchona glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant is notable for its ability to produce alkaloids, including quinine, which has historically been used in medicine. Its bark contains compounds that have been utilized for their antimalarial properties. Cinchona glandulosa typically grows in humid, shaded environments at higher altitudes.
